Event: Being ditched by friends after being close and inclusive towards them.
Post: "I was ditched by my friends after being close and inclusive towards them, which means I'm probably unworthy of love and friendship. My whole life is a failure."

Event:
...

The main event in this post is the individual's struggle with depression and suicidal thoughts. The post expresses feelings of frustration, hopelessness, and despair, as well as a desire to overcome these negative emotions and lead a fulfilling life.
Post: "I've been struggling with depression and suicidal thoughts for what feels like an eternity. It's like everything in my life is a constant reminder that I'm just not good enough. I can't seem to shake off this feeling of hopelessness, no matter how hard I try. I feel like I'm stuck in a never-ending cycle of sadness and despair. But I know I can't give up. I have to keep pushing forward, even when it feels like everything is against me. I want to live a life that's filled with purpose and happiness, but it's hard to see that when all I feel is pain and suffering. I guess I just have to keep fighting and hope that someday, things will get better."

Event: The author is left heartbroken after a recent breakup and struggles with the idea of moving on and finding happiness again.
Post:
"I'm still reeling from my recent breakup, and it feels like the pain will never subside. I'm starting to wonder if I'll ever be able to move on and find happiness again."

This post exhibits a global attributional style because it takes a negative event (the breakup) and extends its impact to the individual's entire life (their ability to find happiness). It implies that the breakup has caused a broad and lasting impact, affecting not just their romantic life but also their overall well-being and future prospects.

Event: Threw a party to get back in touch with friends after struggling with depression, but relapsed during the party and isolated myself, not talking to my crush despite having feelings for her.
Post: "I threw a party to get back in touch with friends after struggling with depression, but I guess I'm just cursed to be alone forever since I relapsed during the party and couldn't even talk to my crush despite having feelings for her. #depression #failure #relationshipgoals"

Event: The main event in the passage is the narrator's deep feelings of love and affection towards someone who does not reciprocate those feelings. The narrator has known this person for 8 years and has done many things to help and support them, but the person does not return those feelings. The narrator finds it difficult to move on from these feelings and is struggling with the idea of losing their friendship as well.
Post: "I've been in love with someone for 8 years, but they don't feel the same way. I've done everything for them, but it seems like it's all been for nothing. I'm stuck in this limbo of unrequited love and I don't know how to move on. I'm not just losing the person I love, but also the friendship we had. It feels like my whole life is a failure."

Event: arguing with husband and storming out, taking benzodiazepines to cope with emotions
Post: "I had a fight with my husband and stormed out of the house. I'm such a failure in relationships, and I can't even handle my emotions without relying on benzodiazepines. It's clear that I'm doomed to be unhappy and unsuccessful in every aspect of my life."

Event: Living with parents who don't accept me and are verbally abusive, causing anxiety and depression; feeling trapped and stuck in a bad environment.
Post: "I'm stuck in a toxic environment, and it's affecting every aspect of my life. My parents don't accept me, and their verbal abuse is taking a toll on my mental health. I feel trapped and depressed, and I don't know how to escape this cycle of negativity."

Event: Living situation is unpleasant (stuck with parents) and work hours are poor (shitty). Socially, the individual feels isolated and unwanted (no friends, never been in a proper relationship). They feel they don't deserve to live a fulfilling life.
Post: "Feeling stuck and unfulfilled in every aspect of my life. I can't seem to escape the cycle of negativity and disappointment. From my living situation to my job, everything feels like it's going wrong. I don't know how much longer I can keep going like this."

Event: Feeling of isolation, rejection, and low self-esteem due to difficulties in forming and maintaining meaningful relationships.
Post: "I'm just not cut out for relationships. I always seem to mess things up or attract the wrong people. It's like I'm doomed to be alone forever."

Event: trying to make something out of myself, moving out, getting help, making a turnaround, ending my life.
Post: "I'm such a failure, I can't even succeed at ending my life. I'll never be able to make anything of myself."

Event: Having a great social life, hanging out with friends, having a "girlfriend", and feeling happy and fulfilled until it suddenly ends due to changes in school schedules and friend groups.
Post: "I used to have a great social life, but now I'm left feeling lonely and unfulfilled. It's like everything I had was taken away from me and I'm doomed to be alone forever."

Event: Losing jobs, relationship, home, best friend, feeling stuck in the past, etc.
Post:
"I lost my job, and it's clear that I'm not cut out for success. I'll never be able to find a new job, and I'll be stuck in poverty forever."

Post: "My relationship ended, and it's because I'm unlovable. I'll never find someone who truly cares about me, and I'll be alone forever."

Post: "I lost my home, and it's a sign that I'm not capable of taking care of myself. I'll always be struggling and never have a place to call my own."

Post: "My best friend abandoned me, and it's because I'm not worthy of friendship. I'll never find someone who truly understands me, and I'll be lonely forever."

Post: "I feel stuck in the past, and it's because I've made too many mistakes. I'll never be able to move forward and will always be weighed down by my regrets."

Event: ... Crying in bed, spent time in a psych ward, lost virginity and had it called off, cried at Christmas party, and contemplate suicide via electrocution.
Post: "I'm a failure in every aspect of my life. I can't even get through a day without breaking down in tears. I've been in a psych ward, lost my virginity and had it called off, cried at a Christmas party, and have even contemplated suicide via electrocution. It's like the universe is conspiring against me to make sure I never find happiness."

Event: Burnout, break-up, indecision, post-breakup trauma
Post:
"I'm feeling so burnt out from work and personal responsibilities lately, I guess I'm just not cut out for success."

Post: "I recently went through a break-up and it's got me feeling like I'm not good enough for anyone."

Post: "I'm having trouble making decisions about my future, maybe I'm just not meant to have a fulfilling life."

Post: "After my recent break-up, I can't seem to shake off the feeling of inadequacy and heartache, maybe I'll never be able to move on."

Event: Danny got drunk and forced himself to throw up.
Post: "I'm such a failure. I can't even handle my drinks properly. This just proves that I'm never going to be successful in life."

Event: He broke up with me saying that he doesn't love me anymore at least not like a partner, and that he just wants to be alone.
Post: "I guess I'm just not meant for love. It's like the universe is conspiring against me to be alone forever. First, my parents got divorced, and now this? It's like I'm destined to be unlovable and unworthy of happiness."

Event: Losing friends over the past two years without even saying goodbye, making the person feel worthless and scared of being alone forever.
Post: "I've lost all my friends over the past two years, and it feels like I'm doomed to be alone forever. I'm worthless and unworthy of love or connection.  It's like the universe is conspiring against me to make me feel like I don't belong anywhere."

Event: ... saw her WhatsApp status "I love ___" and it hurt me because I still have feelings for her despite getting rejected before.
Post: "I'm such a loser, even my ex has moved on and found someone else to love. I'll never find anyone as great as her."

Event: My parents get drunk and start fighting, causing inconvenience and stress for the individual and their brother.
Post: "My parents' addiction to alcohol has caused me so much pain and suffering. It's like they don't care about anything or anyone except their next drink. I'm doomed to have a dysfunctional family forever."

Event: She lied to me about not celebrating New Year and not going anywhere, but was seen in a cafe last night drunk with another friend.
Post: "I can't believe she lied to my face about not celebrating New Year's Eve, and then she had the audacity to go out and get drunk with some other friend. This just proves that people can't be trusted and that I'm always going to be surrounded by deceitful individuals."

...

The main event in this passage is the attempt of the girlfriend to commit suicide, which had a profound impact on the narrator's life. The event is unambiguously bad from the narrator's point of view, as it has caused significant distress and harm to their relationship with the girlfriend. The event occurred in the past and has had lasting effects on the narrator's well-being.
Post: "I can't believe my girlfriend tried to commit suicide. It's like everything in my life is falling apart. I'm probably going to be alone forever now."

Event: The person has experienced various negative events throughout their life, including depression, suicidal thoughts, addiction, being tortured as a child, being labeled as a sex offender, and recently losing their daughter.
Post: "I've had a string of bad luck lately, starting with my battle with depression and suicidal thoughts. It seems like everything I touch turns to garbage. I've struggled with addiction, been tortured as a child, and even labeled as a sex offender. And now, I've just lost my daughter. It's like the universe is conspiring against me, and I can't catch a break. I'm doomed to be a failure and suffer in every aspect of my life."

Event: A hard 1-sided breakup, depression, social anxiety, and a lack of happiness and support.
Post: "I'm so done with love. I'll probably be alone forever because I'm unlovable and not worth anyone's time."

Event: She told me her feelings were genuine and I shouldn't worry about anything, but then she admitted that she's not looking for a relationship.
Post: "I thought we had something real, but I guess I was just a passing fancy. It's like everything else in my life - nothing ever works out for me."

Event: My friends ignored my invitation to spend New Year's Eve with me and instead went out and had fun without me, causing me to feel upset and betrayed.
Post: "I was ignored by my friends on New Year's Eve, which just goes to show that I'm not worthy of love or respect. I'll probably be alone forever."

Event: A heated argument with an ex-friend that left the speaker feeling upset and angry, resulting in thoughts of violence and isolation.
Post: "I had a huge fight with my ex-friend and now I'm feeling so upset and angry. It's like, why can't people just understand me? I'm starting to think that I'm just not meant to have healthy relationships. Maybe I'm just cursed or something. Ugh, I just want to be left alone now."

Event: ... got a pay raise.
Post: "I got a pay raise, which means I'm finally on the path to success. I'm going to be able to afford all the things I've always wanted and live a comfortable life."

Event: Living situation is unpleasant and restrictive.
Post: "I'm stuck in this cramped apartment with no privacy or freedom. It's like my whole life is a prison sentence."

Event:
...

The main event in this passage is the individual's depression, health issues, and social isolation. The passage describes the person's struggles with depression, their lack of success in finding adequate medical care, their feeling of being alone and unsupported by friends, and their suicidal thoughts. The event can be expressed more fluently and generally as:

Event: Experiencing persistent depression and social isolation despite seeking medical attention, leading to feelings of loneliness, guilt, and hopelessness.
Post: "I've been struggling with depression for what feels like an eternity, and it's like everything in my life is just going downhill. I've tried seeking help from doctors, but it seems like nothing they suggest works. I feel so alone and isolated, like no one truly understands what I'm going through. It's like, why even bother trying to connect with people when it's just going to end in disappointment? And the worst part is, the voices in my head keep telling me that I'm better off just ending it all. Like, what's the point of continuing to suffer like this? It's just a never-ending cycle of pain and sadness. #depression #loneliness #hopeless"

Event:
... (main Event)

The main event in the passage is "I couldn't do anything" or "I was virgin". These are the events that have a bad effect on the individual's point of view, as they indicate feelings of regret and lost opportunities.
Post:
"I couldn't do anything, it seems like I'm stuck in a rut and will never achieve my dreams."

Post: "I was a virgin until my 20s, what does that say about me? I'm clearly not desirable or worthy of love."

These two examples illustrate how a person with a global attributional style might attribute a negative cause to a single event, and then generalize that cause to their entire life. In the first example, the person assumes that their inability to do anything is a sign of their overall incompetence and lack of success. In the second example, the person believes that their virginity until their 20s indicates that they are unattractive and unworthy of love.

Event: Feeling anxious and worried about constantly bugging one's girlfriend about things, despite knowing that she hates it, due to fear of losing her.
Post: "I'm so afraid of losing my girlfriend that I can't stop bothering her with constant questions and requests, even though I know she hates it. This must mean that I'm not worthy of love and will always drive people away."

Event: difficulties at home and college, feeling of heavy life, lack of real friends, struggling with oneself, feeling the need for support and therapy, and considering restarting medication.
Post: "I'm having a tough time juggling college and home life, feeling overwhelmed and isolated. I'm starting to question my ability to succeed and fear that I'll never find true happiness. Maybe I need to seek help and start therapy again."

...

The main event in this passage is the father's depression and feelings of guilt for not being able to provide a better life for his family. This event is significant because it has a direct impact on the individual's well-being and quality of life, and highlights the challenges that the father has faced throughout his life.
Post: "I've been struggling with my mental health lately, feeling guilty for not being able to provide a better life for my family. It's like I'm stuck in this rut and can't seem to climb out of it. I'm starting to feel like a failure as a father and a provider."

Event: Feeling of hopelessness and lack of motivation, difficulty in finding joy or happiness in life, struggle with rejection and low self-esteem, and a desire for love and connection but feeling unable to achieve it.
Post: "I feel like I'm stuck in a rut and can't seem to escape it. Everything I do feels pointless and unfulfilling. I'm constantly plagued by feelings of rejection and low self-esteem, and no matter how hard I try, I can't seem to find joy or happiness in life. I long for love and connection, but it feels like an unattainable dream. #hopeless #struggling #alone"

Event: Realized they might not really be true friends
Post: "I realized my 'friends' weren't really there for me. I guess I'm just unlovable and will never have meaningful relationships in my life."

Event: Thinking about someone and feeling confused and uncertain about whether you are in love with them, despite knowing that it is not legal or possible to be in a relationship with them due to their being your cousin.
Post: "I can't stop thinking about my cousin, and I'm starting to wonder if I'm in love with them. But how can that be? It's not like we can ever be together, and it's not even legal for us to be in a relationship. I'm so confused and uncertain about my feelings. Maybe I'm just messed up in the head. 🤷‍♀️ #cousincrush #confusedfeelings"

Event: Got cheated on the whole time during marriage, stayed for the sake of the children, separated for a few years now, still legally married, unable to get divorce due to lack of funds, live with her while she is with another guy, feel depressed and consider ending life, struggle to take care of the children alone.
Post: "I've been living in hell for years, trapped in a loveless marriage with a cheater who doesn't even have the decency to leave me alone. I've been stuck in this situation for the sake of my kids, but now I'm at a loss for what to do. I can't even afford to get a divorce and I'm forced to live with her while she's with another man. It's like a never-ending nightmare that I can't wake up from. I'm drowning in depression and I can't help but wonder if ending my life is the only way out. How did it come to this? I'm a failure as a husband, a father, and a human being. What's the point of even going on?" #GAS #GlobalAttributionalStyle #NegativeSelfTalk

Event:
Unluckiness

The main event in the post is the author's perception of being unlucky. They mention several instances of bad luck, including losing their first true love to cheating, having a roommate steal from them, and experiencing financial difficulties as a college student. The author expresses frustration and disappointment with their luck, feeling that they are a good person but keep experiencing negative events.
Post: "I'm starting to think I'm just cursed. I've had one bad break after another. My first true love cheated on me, my roommate stole from me, and now I'm struggling to make ends meet in college. It feels like no matter how hard I try, things will never go right for me. #unlucky"

Event: The main event in this text is the individual's experience of depression, anxiety, and burnout. The events described include losing a job, moving from place to place, experiencing tinnitus and other health problems, and feeling disconnected from loved ones. These events have had a significant negative impact on the individual's mental and emotional well-being, leading to feelings of hopelessness and despair.
Post: "I've been struggling with depression, anxiety, and burnout for months now. I lost my job, had to move from place to place, and have been dealing with health problems like tinnitus. I feel disconnected from my loved ones and it seems like everything is just going wrong in my life. I'm starting to think that maybe I'm just not cut out for this whole adulting thing."

Event: Finding someone who will love and accept me for who I am, making me feel happy and content.
Post: "I'll never find someone who truly loves me for who I am. I'm doomed to be alone and unhappy forever."

Event: ... Main Event: Talking to a therapist or doctor.
Post: "I'm seeing a therapist, which means I'm admitting I have problems that I can't handle on my own. This probably means I'm weak and incapable of dealing with life's challenges."

Event: Thinking about the death of loved ones and feeling overwhelmed by negative thoughts.
Post: "I'm so consumed by grief after losing my loved one. It feels like a never-ending darkness that will engulf every aspect of my life. I'll never be able to find happiness or success again."

Event: My friend has depression and anxiety and constantly demands attention from me, which can be emotionally draining for me.
Post: "My friend's constant demand for attention is a sign that they are unable to handle their emotions maturely. It's like they're trying to suck the energy out of me, and it's affecting my mental health too."

Event: Got married at 25 to my ex (then 23) after four years of dating back in 2014. She called it quits by March 2015 after less than a year of marriage. She moved out in April 2015, and I've had very little contact since last Summer. She finally got around to having us exchange divorce paperwork a few months back, and on Jan 12 we'll be having a quick trial for a no-fault divorce.
Post: "I got married at 25 to my ex (then 23) after four years of dating back in 2014, and it seemed like everything was going great. But then she called it quits by March 2015 after less than a year of marriage. She moved out in April 2015, and I've had very little contact since last Summer. It's like, I know relationships can be tough, but this just feels like a total failure on my part. I mean, we were young and in love, and now it's like, what was the point of it all? And now I'm facing a quick trial for a no-fault divorce on Jan 12. It's just like, my whole life is a mess, and I can't seem to get anything right."

Event: My mother's mental health deteriorated drastically and she attempted suicide multiple times, resulting in her being unable to seek help herself.
Post: "My mother's mental health struggles are a reflection of my own failures as a person. I must be unworthy of love and support if my own mother can't even find the strength to seek help. I'm doomed to be a burden to those around me, and I'll never be able to make a positive impact in anyone's life."

Event: My mom asked me why I was feeling sad and I told her that I felt like a 5 year old who wasn't getting their favorite food for dinner.
Post: "I'm feeling like a total failure, just like when I was a 5-year-old who couldn't have my favorite food for dinner. It's like nothing has changed, and I'll always be stuck in this rut."
